Helmholtz's theory of object-based light perception has had a profound influence on our understanding of vision and perception, and it has led to many important discoveries in the fields of psychology, neuroscience, and computer science. For example, it has inspired the development of advanced computer vision algorithms that can recognize and interpret objects in images and videos, and it has also influenced the development of new treatments for vision disorders such as amblyopia.
